intro: Tapeinosperma ampliflorum, commonly known as the broadflower tamarind, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a hard, leathery capsule. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
